alert.note: Alert for Butler; Grayson; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Butler, west central Grayson and southern Ohio Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 354 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hartford, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Grayson, north central Butler and southern Ohio Counties, including the following locations... Horse Branch, Steff, Aberdeen, Windy Hill, Eden, Flint Springs, Do Stop, Neafus, Gilstrap and Logansport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
